results.title: U.S. Territories Investor Protection Act of 2017
results.short_title: U.S. Territories Investor Protection Act of 2017
results.committees: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee
results.latest_major_action: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.
results.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.) U.S. Territories Investor Protection Act of 2017  (Sec. 2) This bill amends the Investment Company Act of 1940 to apply the Act to investment companies created under the laws of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, or any other U.S. possession.
results.summary_short: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.) U.S. Territories Investor Protection Act of 2017  (Sec. 2) This bill amends the Investment Company Act of 1940 to apply the Act to investment companies created under the laws of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, or any other U.S. possession.

actions.description: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H2982)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1366.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H2981-2983)
Mr. Hill moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 60.
Reported by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 115-103.
Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 58 - 0.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
